name: Rum With Iced Hibiscus Tea
description: Hibiscus tea creates an almost-instant punch. If you prefer it sweeter, add simple syrup to taste. And be sure to plan ahead; the tea steeps for eight hours.
recipeYield: 1 drink (and enough tea for many more)

recipeInstructions.text: To make the chilled hibiscus tea, put ½ cup dried hibiscus flowers in a large bowl. Add 1 quart cold filtered water. Refrigerate for 8 hours. Strain; discard solids. Keep cold.
Fill a highball glass with ice and add rum, tea and soda water. Grate a little nutmeg on top and garnish with a pineapple chunk.

video.name: Rum With Iced Hibiscus Tea
video.description: Add chilled hibiscus tea to rum for an almost-instant punch.
